de6a82ca-3839-4fcc-b93d-f04b5fbea7f2.description: The Intro to Flexo Workshop, taught by flexographic experts at Clemson University’s Sonoco Institute of Packaging Design & Graphics, provides the fundamental knowledge of the flexographic printing process. This online course combines visual instruction with interactive modules utilizing the Sonoco Institute’s STRIPE Online platform – a real-to-life simulation of the institute’s own pressroom and narrow-web flexographic press. Click on Additional Details to learn more & register!
de6a82ca-3839-4fcc-b93d-f04b5fbea7f2.name: Intro to Flexo

badge_template_activities.title: Complete eleven modules that focus on Major Printing Processes, Image Reproduction, Ink and Ink Delivery, Flexographic Platemaking, Press Component Identification, Density and Tone Value, Evaluating a Banded. Anilox Test, Measuring Color, Prepress for Flexography, Process Control and Troubleshooting, and Current Trends in Flexography.

434e0bc7-df23-4201-8396-f6ae9f1e4438.description: School Gardening for SC Educators is an extension-based program that combines horticulture training, ongoing technical support and equipment for schools to start and sustain successful school gardens. The program uses innovative approaches to overcome common school gardening obstacles such as poor soil, seasonality and food safety concerns specific to school gardening. Upon completion, licensed teachers receive 20 renewal credits from the South Carolina Department of Education.
434e0bc7-df23-4201-8396-f6ae9f1e4438.name: School Gardening for SC Educators

badge_template_activities.title: Educators engage in a 5-week online professional development course. Teams of three school faculty members are encouraged to participate together to build sustainability into the program. Licensed South Carolina teachers receive 20 renewal credits approved by the South Carolina Department of Education upon completion.

865fb4fd-b131-4a86-bc85-63605935224c.description: This introductory level horticulture-based course is designed to help new and beginning community gardeners launch their programs successfully. In addition to the online course, participants will receive educational tools and resources to support the community garden.
865fb4fd-b131-4a86-bc85-63605935224c.name: Cultivating Communities

badge_template_activities.title: In Cultivating Communities, participants will learn through engaging instructional videos and gain access to helpful community gardening resources. To complete the course, gardeners are required to complete three practical activities to begin the community garden development process.

aeddffac-93ae-4e8d-9e25-5fe3764d01e5.description: Leading people is one of the most critical functions for anyone in organizations today, regardless of job title. Leaders must be capable of not only leading horizontally and vertically, but also cross-culturally, and, perhaps most critically, leading oneself. In this series, we will dive deep to explore, experiment, and hone leadership skills across: leading the self, leading teams, leading organizations, and leading across cultures.
aeddffac-93ae-4e8d-9e25-5fe3764d01e5.name: Advanced Management & Leadership Program

badge_template_activities.title: Upon completion of this course, you will earn Clemson’s Advanced Management and Leadership Badge, offered from The Department of Management in the Wilbur O. and Ann Powers College of Business. You will also be eligible to earn 24 professional development credits (PDCs) toward your SHRM recertification record. https://www.clemson.edu/business/departments/management/programs/executive-education.html

ffa2a353-116d-40cd-88d1-21987fa25459.description: In this course, educators will enter the world of the small but mighty pollinators that live alongside us. We will meet some of the insects and plants who, through pollination, provide us with foods we love. After discovering their impact, we will dive into the ways that educators can contribute to pollinator conservation and get their students involved by developing a school or community pollinator project or incorporating pollinator activities in their classrooms.
ffa2a353-116d-40cd-88d1-21987fa25459.name: Bee A Friend to Pollinators

badge_template_activities.title: Participants are expected to engage actively in the course by watching videos and reading lessons, completing all quizzes, and participating in all discussion forums.

84e9382c-611b-4dd3-b237-3f52d63e4306.description: The Business Anthropology & Human Behavior Certificate Program, offered through Clemson University, brings together the domains of Business and Anthropology to teach participants qualitative methods, cross-cultural awareness, and foundational business concepts. Specific methodologies taught include ethnography, participant observation, interviewing, and content analysis. This highly interdisciplinary program provides training in fields such as marketing, anthropology, psychology, and leadership.
84e9382c-611b-4dd3-b237-3f52d63e4306.name: Business Anthropology & Human Behavior Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Completion demonstrates that the participant has successfully completed two required courses: Business Anthropology and Qualitative Methods for the Social Sciences, and a Capstone Seminar encompassing teamwork, leadership and strategy components.

46350633-2820-445a-a354-af6fbd164e1a.description: Participants will meet in groups to learn the fundamentals of online teaching and course design, based on Quality Matters' “Bridge to Quality” framework. Sessions are divided between time devoted to pedagogy and design principles and hands-on workshop time for instructors to develop their basic Canvas sites. Developed by Clemson Online.
46350633-2820-445a-a354-af6fbd164e1a.name: Online Course Bootcamp

badge_template_activities.title: 8 contact hours, course map with learning objectives, Canvas site in progress

2d7b0103-11c0-452c-8351-800da1bd99e9.description: Awarded to the 1st Place winner of the 2021 Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium
2d7b0103-11c0-452c-8351-800da1bd99e9.name: Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium - 1st Place

badge_template_activities.title: Research experience indicates the individual is able to conduct original and independent research with technical expertise in academic and/or non-academic related professions.

Communication skills indicates the individual is able to be succinct and communicate with a variety of audiences; has the ability to dive deeper into the research in a technical context but also present a technical topic to a non-specialist audience; demonstrates the ability to communicate to diverse audiences in written, digital, and oral formats.
Passion for the project indicates the individual has a desire for learning, a hunger for innovation, and a commitment to sharing the broader impacts of their research with the public.

90f88ab7-9bbc-49c8-8bd4-d9504d2cefe9.description: Awarded to the 3rd Place winner of the 2021 Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium
90f88ab7-9bbc-49c8-8bd4-d9504d2cefe9.name: Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium - 3rd Place

badge_template_activities.title: Research experience indicates the individual is able to conduct original and independent research with technical expertise in academic and/or non-academic related professions.

Communication skills indicates the individual is able to be succinct and communicate with a variety of audiences; has the ability to dive deeper into the research in a technical context but also present a technical topic to a non-specialist audience; demonstrates the ability to communicate to diverse audiences in written, digital, and oral formats.
Passion for the project indicates the individual has a desire for learning, a hunger for innovation, and a commitment to sharing the broader impacts of their research with the public.

064f7a23-12ed-4c28-89e6-f4d8a032dcee.description: Awarded to the People's Choice winner of the 2021 Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium
064f7a23-12ed-4c28-89e6-f4d8a032dcee.name: Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium - People's Choice

badge_template_activities.title: Research experience indicates the individual is able to conduct original and independent research with technical expertise in academic and/or non-academic related professions.

Communication skills indicates the individual is able to be succinct and communicate with a variety of audiences; has the ability to dive deeper into the research in a technical context but also present a technical topic to a non-specialist audience; demonstrates the ability to communicate to diverse audiences in written, digital, and oral formats.
Passion for the project indicates the individual has a desire for learning, a hunger for innovation, and a commitment to sharing the broader impacts of their research with the public.

0fd64a39-b2f1-420f-9707-6b86bc74d177.description: In Spanish, The Intro to Flexo Workshop, taught by flexographic experts at Clemson University’s Sonoco Institute of Packaging Design & Graphics, provides the fundamental knowledge of the flexographic printing process. This online course combines visual instruction with interactive modules utilizing the Sonoco Institute’s STRIPE Online platform – a real-to-life simulation of the institute’s own pressroom and narrow-web flexographic press. Click on Additional Details to register!
0fd64a39-b2f1-420f-9707-6b86bc74d177.name: Intro to Flexo - Spanish

badge_template_activities.title: Complete eleven modules that focus on Major Printing Processes, Image Reproduction, Ink and Ink Delivery, Flexographic Platemaking, Press Component Identification, Density and Tone Value, Evaluating a Banded. Anilox Test, Measuring Color, Prepress for Flexography, Process Control and Troubleshooting, and Current Trends in Flexography.

67bf94fc-8059-41b5-81e0-b1c4e9f338e1.description: Special topic training courses intensively train Master Gardeners and Master Naturalists beyond the core training required for each program, allowing for specialization in related subjects. Basics of Entomology focuses on insect identification as well as management plans for both protection and control.
67bf94fc-8059-41b5-81e0-b1c4e9f338e1.name: Basics of Entomology

badge_template_activities.title: Students will document their learning through the completion of a digital photograph collection using iNaturalist.

a9b4a697-1fc3-4d0d-b678-082bad45182e.description: The Carolina Yards Program recognizes homeowners that implement the principles of environmental landscape management. By using these environmentally friendly landscaping practices, homeowners can make positive changes in the environmental quality of their yards, neighborhoods and surrounding waterways.
a9b4a697-1fc3-4d0d-b678-082bad45182e.name: Carolina Yards

badge_template_activities.title: This course will introduce you to the Program’s twelve principles of environmental landscape management. Action guides for each principle allow you to reflect on how you are currently managing your yard and provide guidance on actions you can take to create your desired landscape while protecting South Carolina’s natural resources.

53865be2-9f40-4c38-ab22-34010e8fa053.description: In Farming Foundations, you will learn from experts about the basics of successful farming, such as how to prepare your land and soil for planting, how to stay safe, and how to access helpful farming resources. The course is specifically designed to provide foundational information for fruit and vegetable production in South Carolina.
53865be2-9f40-4c38-ab22-34010e8fa053.name: Farming Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: Participants will complete a minimum of the five following activities; 1) Soil Test and Web Soil Survey, 2) Fertility Quiz, 3) Farm Safety and Emergency Plan, 4) Tractor Identification and Maintenance Plan, 5) Farm Tools Inventory Identification, 6) Fertilizer and Lime Exercise, 7) Irrigation Quiz, 8) Irrigation System Design, 9) Create a Seed and Transplant Calendar, 10) Consult with Local Extension Agent, 11) Create a Local Harvest Plan, 12) Supply Chain Plan, or 13) Buzzword Quiz.

6ce36916-b556-4976-bc98-089f9c79720b.description: The South Carolina Master Gardener Volunteer Program trains, selects, and utilizes knowledgeable volunteers to facilitate the educational work of the local Consumer Horticulture Agent by delivering research-based information to citizens of the state. The volunteer training is divided into two parts: instruction and service.
6ce36916-b556-4976-bc98-089f9c79720b.name: Master Gardener Volunteer Training Class

badge_template_activities.title: The Master Gardener Volunteer Training Class (MGVTC) satisfies the instruction requirement. Through the MGVTC, participants receive at least 40 hours of intensive, practical horticultural training. Topics covered include soils and plant nutrition, entomology, plant physiology, plant pathology, vegetable gardening, tree and small fruit culture, lawn management, the culture of woody ornamentals, and problem-solving.

4b1e5400-730e-4130-8a15-50080861186e.description: After completing Master Tree Farmer, participants will gain scientific and practical knowledge to manage forested land to best suit ecological, economical, and recreational forest resources. Master Tree Farmer is intended to build upon a participant’s base knowledge of forestry.
4b1e5400-730e-4130-8a15-50080861186e.name: Master Tree Farmer

badge_template_activities.title: The Master Tree Farmer (MTF) course is a "hybrid" course combining online and face-to-face learning. The course incorporates self-paced lectures, discussion, quizzes, and other web-based methods of participant-instructor interaction, along with hands-on participation activities in the field.

67fc7ab2-060a-4a8a-852d-85f4331dc7d3.description: Municipalities and counties in South Carolina recognize the necessity of inspection and maintenance of stormwater infrastructure. The goal of the course is to offer a comprehensive statewide program for stormwater-related professionals with stormwater dynamics, control measures and practices, maintenance requirements, and tools for a successful inspection.
67fc7ab2-060a-4a8a-852d-85f4331dc7d3.name: Post-Construction BMP Inspector

badge_template_activities.title: The Post-Construction BMP Inspector program ensures that science-based information for low impact development practices and climate change are made available to communities in their evaluation of stormwater infrastructure operation and performance. This program is offered as a five-week online course, followed by a one-day field day. Participants must pass an exam for certification.

3786f7ca-5bf0-49c9-ad2d-902d79f70454.description: Awarded to the 2nd Place winner of the 2021 Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium
3786f7ca-5bf0-49c9-ad2d-902d79f70454.name: Clemson University Graduate Research & Discovery Symposium - 2nd Place
